data.enText: to become, or to make sth softer
Fry the onions until they soften.
a lotion to soften the skin

data.chText: 亚麻籽油可软化僵硬的皮革。
data.enText: Linseed oil will soften stiff leather.
to become or to make sth less bright, rough or strong

data.chText: 树木使房子的轮廓显得柔和。
data.enText: Trees soften the outline of the house.
to become or to make sb/sth more sympathetic and less severe or critical

data.chText: 她感觉自己对他逐渐温和起来。
data.enText: She felt herself softening towards him.

data.chText: 他看着儿子，紧绷的面孔松弛下来。
data.enText: His face softened as he looked at his son.

data.chText: 她稍稍缓和了一下语气。
data.enText: She softened her tone a little.
to reduce the force or the unpleasant effects of sth

data.chText: 气囊用来减轻汽车碰撞的冲击力。
data.enText: Airbags are designed to soften the impact of a car crash.
soften/cushion the blow
to make sth that is unpleasant seem less unpleasant and easier to accept
soften sb↔up
to try to persuade sb to do sth for you by being very nice to them before you ask them

data.chText: 谈生意之前，先送给潜在的客户一些赠品，以联络感情。
data.enText: Potential customers are softened up with free gifts before the sales talk.
to make an enemy weaker and easier to attack

word_means: 态度缓和，变温和，变宽厚

data.enText: soften/cushion the blow
to make sth that is unpleasant seem less unpleasant and easier to accept
soften sb↔up
to try to persuade sb to do sth for you by being very nice to them before you ask them

data.chText: 谈生意之前，先送给潜在的客户一些赠品，以联络感情。
data.enText: Potential customers are softened up with free gifts before the sales talk.
to make an enemy weaker and easier to attack

example: The bread will soften if you pour some liquid on it
This liquid will soften your laundry
He moderated his tone when the students burst out in tears

tr: make (images or sounds) soft or softer
give in, as to influence or pressure

value.def: If you soften something or if it softens, it becomes less hard, stiff, or firm.

example.ex: Soften the butter mixture in a small saucepan...
example.tran: 在小平底锅里将黄油混合物化软。

example.ex: Fry for about 4 minutes, until the onion has softened.
example.tran: 煎 4 分钟左右，直到洋葱变软。

value.def: If one thing softens the damaging effect of another thing, it makes the effect less severe.

example.ex: There were also pledges to soften the impact of the subsidy cuts on the poorer regions.
example.tran: 他们还承诺要减轻削减补贴给较贫困地区带来的影响。

example.ex: ...He could not think how to soften the blow of what he had to tell her.
example.tran: 他要告诉她的事对她打击很大，但他又想不出怎么说才能减轻这种打击。

value.def: If you soften your position, if your position softens, or if you soften, you become more sympathetic and less hostile or critical towards someone or something.

example.ex: The letter shows no sign that the Americans have softened their position...
example.tran: 信里没有任何迹象表明美国人的态度已有所缓和。

example.ex: His party's policy has softened a lot in recent years...
example.tran: 他所在的政党近些年的政策已经变得温和多了。

example.ex: Livy felt herself soften towards Caroline.
example.tran: 莉薇觉得自己对卡罗琳的态度变温和了。

value.def: If your voice or expression softens or if you soften it, it becomes much more gentle and friendly.

example.ex: All at once, Mick's serious expression softened into a grin...
example.tran: 米克严肃的表情一下子变成了笑脸。

example.ex: She did not smile or soften her voice.
example.tran: 她没有笑，声音也没有温和起来。

value.def: If you soften something such as light, a colour, or a sound, you make it less bright or harsh.

example.ex: We wanted to soften the light without destroying the overall effect of space...
example.tran: 我们希望在不破坏整体空间效果的同时，使灯光柔和一些。

example.ex: Stark concrete walls have been softened by a show of fresh flowers.
example.tran: 鲜花摆上之后，突兀的混凝土墙便显得柔和起来。

value.tran: 使(灯光、颜色、声音等)减弱;使变柔和

value.def: Something that softens your skin makes it very smooth and pleasant to touch.

example.ex: ...products designed to moisturize and soften the skin.
example.tran: 使肌肤滋润柔滑的产品
